etymology.description: 皿(皿) (mǐn, "dish") + 㕣(㕣) (miǎn) = overseeing from height -> 監(監) (jiān, "supervise")
etymology.interpretation: The traditional character 監(監) (jiān, "supervise") combines 皿(皿) (mǐn, "dish"), indicating a container or viewing surface, and 㕣(㕣) (miǎn), signifying overseeing or viewing from height. This suggests a role of overseeing or inspecting from above.
etymology.simplification: In simplified character 监(監), the 臣(臣) (chén, "subject") was replaced with 〢, likely as a shorthand, retaining the role of overseeing.

examples.chinese: 他被委派监工(他被委派監工)，确保工程质量(確保工程質量)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bèi wěipài jiān gōng, quèbǎo gōngchéng zhìliàng.
examples.english: He was assigned to supervise the work, ensuring the project’s quality.

examples.chinese: 工头常常亲自监现场(工頭常常親自監現場)。
examples.english: The foreman often personally supervises the site.

examples.chinese: 考试期间(考試期間)，老师认真监考学生(老師認真監考學生)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎoshì qíjiān, lǎoshī rènzhēn jiān kǎo xuéshēng.
examples.english: During the exam period, the teacher diligently supervises the students.
